name: String of Hearts
description: Ceropegia woodii 'Variegated', commonly known as Variegated String of Hearts, is a succulent native to tropical regions of South Africa, Swaziland, and Zimbabwe. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and features trailing stems (60-200 cm long) with small, dramatic, heart-shaped, dark green leaves with distinctive white to pink variegation patterns. The plant displays a trailing growth habit. In its native habitat, it grows in dry, rocky areas. In terrariums or indoor settings, this plant adds vibrant colors and visual interest with its attractive variegated foliage. It's extremely popular among houseplant enthusiasts for its beautiful trailing habit and variegated leaves. Note: toxic if ingested.
careTips: Let soil dry completely between waterings
Avoid overwatering - prone to root rot
Thick leaves store water - drought tolerant
Can trail or climb with support
